NHAI had been entrusted with the work of Construction/Up-gradation and Operations & Management of a major part of the National Highway network of India_ For efficient management of the National Highways, Operation & Maintenance (O&M) activities are to be given due importance for ensuring safety of the highway users: 2  As a of the civil works contract on various contract modes, there is a provision of incident management services which interalia include Highway Patrol Vehicle, Ambulance and Tow-Away Crane. However , it has been observed that there is no mechanism to monitor the performance of these services,  being provided by the Contractor/ Concessionaire. 3_ In order to keep these incident management services robust and swift in response, it has been directed to conduct the mock drills. Accordingly, the following set of guidelines have been issued in this regard: (i) Every night, a suitable time and location along the stretch may be chosen for conducting the mock drill by the Contractor / Concessionaire. The time and location so chosen should on changing every day s0 as to cover different phases of the night as well as different sections of the project highway across the week: (ii) The person-in-charge of the incident management from the Contractor / Concessionaire end; should make a call on the 1033   helpline number   and register their call as the mock drill: must duly describe the nature of the emergency envisioned in the drill as well as their location. (iii) The response time shall start as soon as the call for the mock drill is picked up at the 1033 call centre It is the responsibility of the Contractor / Concessionaire that the contact details of the drivers/ staff, etc. are regularly updated with the 1033 helpline centre. (iv) The on-road units shall wait to proceed until the call from the 1033 call centre reaches them. Once, the 1033 call centre despatch call is received, the Patrol Vehicle/ Highway Surveillance Vehicle along with the Ambulance shall move towards the mock drill location.
